_description: Sentinel Event Rules Knowledge Base - Deterministic event mappings for fast lookup

7000.title: Service failed to start
7000.impact: The affected service and its features may not be available.
actions: Check if the service is essential for your work
Try restarting your computer
Run 'services.msc' and check service dependencies
If the issue persists, check Windows Event Viewer for more details

7001.title: Service dependency failure
7001.impact: A service cannot start because another service it needs is not running.
causes: A required service failed to start first
Network services not ready during boot
actions: Wait a few minutes and check if it resolves itself
Restart your computer
Check which service is the dependency and start it manually

7009.title: Service startup timeout
7009.impact: A service took too long to start. Windows stopped waiting.
causes: System under heavy load during startup
actions: Usually resolves on its own after system fully boots
If persistent, check disk health
Consider increasing service timeout registry values (advanced)

7023.title: Service terminated with error
7023.impact: A background service stopped unexpectedly due to an error.
actions: Check if related features still work
The service may restart automatically
If critical, try restarting the service manually

7031.title: Service crashed and recovered
7031.impact: A service crashed but Windows automatically restarted it.
actions: Usually no action needed - Windows handled it
Monitor if it happens frequently (more than a few times per day)

7034.title: Service crashed unexpectedly
7034.impact: A service stopped without warning. Related functionality may be affected.
actions: Check if the service has restarted
If issues persist, consider reinstalling the affected software
Check for Windows updates

7036.title: Service state changed
7036.impact: A service started or stopped. This is normal Windows operation.
causes: User or software requested the change
actions: No action needed - this is informational

7040.title: Service startup type changed
7040.impact: How a service starts (automatic/manual/disabled) was changed.
actions: No action needed unless you didn't expect this change
If unexpected, check which service was modified

7045.title: New service installed
7045.impact: A new background service was added to Windows.
actions: Verify the service is from expected software
If unexpected, investigate the source (could indicate unwanted software)

Microsoft-Windows-Security-Auditing.description: Windows security audit events (logins, permissions, policy changes)

4624.title: Successful login
4624.impact: Someone logged into the computer successfully.
actions: No action needed for expected logins
Review if login time/type seems unusual

4625.title: Failed login attempt
4625.impact: Someone tried to log in but failed (wrong password or username).
actions: Single failures are normal (typos happen)
Multiple failures from same source may indicate attack
Consider enabling account lockout policy

4634.title: User logged off
actions: No action needed - informational only

4648.title: Login with explicit credentials
4648.impact: A program used specific credentials to access something.
causes: Running a program as different user
Mapped network drive with saved credentials
actions: Normal for system administration
Review if you didn't expect credential use

4672.title: Special privileges assigned
4672.impact: An administrator or system account was granted elevated permissions.
actions: Normal for admin activities
No action needed

4688.title: New process created
actions: Purely informational - shows what programs run
Useful for security auditing

4689.title: Process ended
4689.impact: A program closed or stopped running.
actions: No action needed - informational

4697.title: Service installed
4697.impact: A new Windows service was registered.
actions: Verify the service is from legitimate software
Unexpected services may indicate security issues

4719.title: Audit policy changed
4719.impact: Windows security auditing settings were modified.
actions: Verify the change was intentional
Unauthorized changes may indicate tampering

4732.title: Member added to security group
4732.impact: A user was added to a Windows security group.
actions: Verify if you expected this change
Adding to Administrators group is significant

4733.title: Member removed from security group
4733.impact: A user was removed from a Windows security group.
actions: Verify if you expected this change

DCOM.description: Distributed Component Object Model - inter-process communication

10016.title: DCOM permission warning
10016.impact: A Windows component tried to access something without full permissions. Very common and usually harmless.
causes: Default Windows permissions not perfectly configured
Application requesting more access than needed
actions: This is almost always safe to ignore
Only investigate if you're having actual functionality problems

41.title: Unexpected shutdown (kernel crash)
41.impact: The computer crashed or lost power without proper shutdown. Data may have been lost.
actions: Check if power was interrupted
If frequent, check for driver updates
Monitor system temperatures
Run memory diagnostics (mdsched.exe)

42.title: System entering sleep
42.impact: Computer is going to sleep mode.
actions: No action needed - normal operation

107.title: System resumed from sleep
107.impact: Computer woke up from sleep mode.
actions: No action needed - normal operation

109.title: Kernel power performance
actions: No action needed - normal power management

19.title: Update installed successfully
19.impact: A Windows update was downloaded and installed.
actions: Restart if prompted to complete installation

20.title: Update installation failed
20.impact: A Windows update could not be installed.
actions: Try running Windows Update again
Free up disk space if low
Run Windows Update Troubleshooter

25.title: Update download started
actions: No action needed - normal operation

44.title: Update requires restart
44.impact: An update is waiting for a restart to complete installation.
causes: System files need to be replaced during startup
actions: Restart your computer when convenient
Save your work before restarting

12.title: Operating system started
actions: No action needed - normal startup

13.title: Operating system shutdown
actions: No action needed - normal shutdown

36871.title: TLS/SSL connection failed
36871.impact: A secure connection could not be established.
actions: Check if the website/service is accessible via browser
Verify system date/time is correct
May need to update Windows for newer TLS support

36874.title: TLS connection error
36874.impact: An encrypted connection had a minor issue.
actions: Usually safe to ignore
Update applications that are having connection issues

1000.title: Application crashed
1000.impact: A program stopped working unexpectedly. Any unsaved work may be lost.
actions: Restart the application
Update the software to latest version
If frequent, try reinstalling the app
Check for Windows updates

1002.title: Application stopped responding
1002.impact: A program froze temporarily but may have recovered.
actions: Wait for the program to respond
If stuck, use Task Manager to close it
Close other programs to free up resources

7.title: Bad block on disk
7.impact: A section of your hard drive may be failing. Data could be at risk.
actions: Back up important data immediately
Run 'chkdsk /r' to attempt repair
Consider replacing the drive soon
Check drive health in CrystalDiskInfo or similar

11.title: Disk controller error
11.impact: The disk had trouble reading or writing. May be temporary.
actions: If occasional, usually OK
If frequent, check cables and connections
Back up data as a precaution

15.title: Disk not ready for access
15.impact: The disk device was not ready when Windows tried to access it.
actions: Check physical connections
Try a different USB port
Wait for drive to spin up before accessing

51.title: Disk paging error
51.impact: Windows had trouble accessing virtual memory on disk.
actions: Run disk check
Ensure adequate free space
Check disk health

153.title: Disk write operation retried
153.impact: A write to the disk failed initially but succeeded on retry.
actions: Monitor for increasing frequency
Run 'chkdsk' if frequent
Check SMART status

Microsoft-Windows-WHEA-Logger.description: Windows Hardware Error Architecture - hardware fault logging

17.title: Hardware error corrected
17.impact: A hardware error was detected and automatically corrected. Usually no data loss.
actions: No action needed - error was corrected
Monitor if this occurs frequently (more than a few per week)

18.title: Uncorrectable hardware error
18.impact: A hardware error occurred that could not be corrected. This may cause instability.
actions: Run Windows Memory Diagnostic (mdsched.exe)
Check CPU and RAM temperatures
Test RAM with MemTest86
Consider hardware replacement if persistent

19.title: Machine check exception
19.impact: The CPU reported a serious internal error. May cause system instability.
actions: Check CPU temperatures immediately
Disable any overclocking
Ensure adequate cooling
Update BIOS/UEFI firmware

47.title: Corrected platform error
47.impact: A platform (motherboard) error was detected and corrected.
actions: Usually no action needed
Monitor for frequency - occasional is normal

Microsoft-Windows-Dhcp-Client.description: DHCP client - automatic IP address assignment

1001.title: DHCP lease obtained
1001.impact: Your computer received an IP address from the network router.
actions: No action needed - normal operation

1002.title: DHCP lease renewed
1002.impact: Your network address was renewed successfully.
actions: No action needed - normal operation

1003.title: DHCP server unreachable
1003.impact: Could not reach the DHCP server. Internet may not work.
actions: Check your network connection
Restart your router
Run 'ipconfig /release' then 'ipconfig /renew'

1006.title: DHCP address conflict
1006.impact: Another device on your network has the same IP address.
causes: Static IP conflicts with DHCP range
actions: Restart your computer to get a new address
Check router settings for IP conflicts
Release and renew your IP address

1014.title: DNS name resolution timeout
1014.impact: Could not look up a website name. The site may be temporarily inaccessible.
actions: Try visiting the website again
Run 'ipconfig /flushdns' to clear DNS cache
Try using different DNS (8.8.8.8 or 1.1.1.1)

1015.title: DNS server not responding
1015.impact: Your configured DNS server is not answering. Internet browsing may fail.
actions: Wait a minute and try again
Change to Google DNS (8.8.8.8) or Cloudflare (1.1.1.1)
Restart your router

7001.title: User logon started
7001.impact: A user is logging into Windows.
actions: No action needed - normal operation

7002.title: User logoff completed
7002.impact: A user has logged out of Windows.
actions: No action needed - normal operation

6005.title: Shell loaded
actions: No action needed - normal logon

6006.title: Shell notification
6006.impact: The Windows shell (desktop) reported an event.
actions: No action needed - informational

1074.title: System shutdown or restart initiated
1074.impact: A user or process initiated a shutdown or restart.
causes: User clicked Shut Down or Restart
actions: No action needed - normal operation

1076.title: Unexpected shutdown reason logged
1076.impact: Windows asked why the last shutdown was unexpected.
causes: Admin noted reason for unplanned restart
actions: Review if unexpected shutdowns are occurring

Microsoft-Windows-DistributedCOM.description: Distributed COM activation and permission events

10010.title: DCOM server timeout
10010.impact: A COM server didn't respond in time. Usually harmless.
actions: Usually no action needed
Investigate only if related features don't work

10016.title: DCOM permission issue
10016.impact: A DCOM component access was logged. Very common and almost always harmless.
actions: Safe to ignore in almost all cases
Only investigate if you have actual functionality problems

VSS.description: Volume Shadow Copy Service - backup snapshots

12289.title: Shadow copy created successfully
12289.impact: A backup snapshot of your drive was created.
actions: No action needed - backup completed

8193.title: Shadow copy failed
8193.impact: Could not create a backup snapshot. System Restore may not work.
actions: Free up disk space (10% free recommended)
Restart the Volume Shadow Copy service
Run 'vssadmin list writers' to check for errors

12291.title: Shadow copy deleted
12291.impact: An old backup snapshot was removed to free space.
actions: No action needed - normal maintenance

6005.title: Event log service started
6005.impact: Windows started recording events. Usually means the computer just booted.
actions: No action needed - normal startup marker

6006.title: Event log service stopped
6006.impact: Windows stopped recording events. Usually means the computer is shutting down.
actions: No action needed - normal shutdown marker

6008.title: Unexpected shutdown detected
6008.impact: The previous shutdown was not clean. May indicate crash or power loss.
actions: Check for crash dump files in C:\Windows\Minidump
If frequent, investigate hardware/driver issues
Consider using a UPS for power protection

6013.title: System uptime
6013.impact: Shows how long Windows has been running since last boot.
actions: No action needed - informational only

100.title: Scheduled task started
actions: No action needed - normal operation

101.title: Scheduled task completed
actions: No action needed - normal operation

102.title: Scheduled task failed
102.impact: A scheduled task could not complete successfully.
actions: Check Task Scheduler for the failed task details
Verify the program or script still exists
Check task run as credentials

201.title: Task action completed
201.impact: A specific action within a task finished.
actions: No action needed - informational

10.title: WMI filter error
10.impact: A WMI query in Group Policy had an error. Policy may not apply correctly.
actions: Usually only relevant in enterprise environments
Check Group Policy for WMI filter issues

5858.title: WMI query failed
5858.impact: An application's WMI query failed. The app may not get system info it needs.
actions: If apps are misbehaving, try: winmgmt /resetrepository
Usually safe to ignore if no functionality issues

55.title: File system corruption detected
55.impact: The file system structure has errors. Files may be inaccessible.
actions: Run 'chkdsk /f' on the affected drive
Back up data from the drive
Check disk health

98.title: Volume mounted successfully
98.impact: A drive or partition was made available to Windows.
actions: No action needed - normal operation

unknown_error.title: System error recorded
unknown_error.impact: Windows encountered an error condition in one of its components. This is like a report that something didn't go as expected — though it may not always affect what you're doing.
causes: A software component or driver encountered an unexpected condition
The system tried to perform an operation that couldn't be completed
A temporary resource shortage (memory, handles, or connections)
actions: Check if any applications or features stopped working around this time
If this error repeats frequently (more than 5 times in an hour), it may indicate a deeper issue
Search online for this specific Event ID + the source name for detailed troubleshooting
If no problems are noticeable, this error may be safely ignored

unknown_warning.title: System warning recorded
unknown_warning.impact: Windows logged a warning about a non-critical issue. Think of this as Windows saying 'heads up' rather than 'emergency'. The system continues to function normally in most cases.
causes: A component noticed a condition that may become a problem if left unaddressed
Resource usage is higher than optimal but not critical
A process took longer than expected to complete
A deprecated feature or configuration was detected
actions: This is typically safe to ignore unless you notice related problems
If you see many warnings from the same source, investigate that component
Check if there are available updates for the affected software or driver

unknown_information.title: System activity logged
unknown_information.impact: Windows recorded a routine operational event. This is normal housekeeping — Windows logs thousands of these every day as it manages services, updates settings, and responds to your actions.
causes: A system service started, stopped, or changed state
A configuration value was read or modified
A scheduled task or background process completed
The system is logging normal operational telemetry
actions: No action needed — this is purely informational
These events are useful for troubleshooting but don't indicate problems
You can safely ignore informational events in normal circumstances

unknown_critical.title: Critical system event
unknown_critical.impact: Windows detected a serious issue that may affect system stability, data integrity, or security. Critical events are rare and typically indicate something that genuinely needs attention.
causes: A core Windows component or driver encountered a fatal error
Hardware may be malfunctioning (disk, memory, or power subsystem)
A security-sensitive operation failed or was blocked
The system may have recovered from a crash or unexpected shutdown
actions: Check if your computer is working normally — can you open programs and access files?
If this is a one-time event after a restart, it may have been a temporary glitch
For persistent critical events, consider running Windows diagnostics (type 'reliability' in Start menu)
Back up important files as a precaution if you see multiple critical events
Don't panic — even critical events often have simple solutions

security_1314.title: Security log access denied
security_1314.impact: The Windows Security event log contains sensitive audit information and requires administrator privileges to read. This is a security feature, not a problem.
causes: Sentinel is running without administrator rights
Windows restricts Security log access to protect audit integrity
Your user account doesn't have security audit privileges
actions: To view Security events: Right-click Sentinel and select 'Run as administrator'
This is expected behavior — Windows protects these logs by design
Other event logs (Application, System) are still accessible normally

severity_definitions.Minor: Minor issue, usually safe to ignore unless frequent
severity_definitions.Warning: Something that may need attention but isn't critical
severity_definitions.Critical: Significant issue that should be addressed
